page.title: 11Dean Farm
page.content: On the outskirts of Whitwell Village stands a beautiful old stone house called{Dean's Farm.}The present house dates from 1702, but there has been a dwelling here for more than 600 years. In the grounds is an original water system dating back 600-700 years. The water is used today to irrigate the garden. There is also a collection of ancient farm implements and machinery. On this unusual farm the farmer has all the necessary equipment to run a large mixed farm of about 200 acres. He keeps 150 sheep(Dorset Horns) and a herd of 96 Friesian cows. Fodder crops; barley,swedes and grass(which is made into hay and silage) are grown for the animals.
